metadata.title: CVE-2016-9919 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The icmp6_send function in net/ipv6/icmp.c in the Linux kernel through4.8.12 omits a certain check of the dst data structure, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (panic) via a fragmented IPv6packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9919` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-185-generic - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-4.4.0-185-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-4.4.0-185-lowlatency - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-185-generic - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-185-lowlatency - 4.4.0-185.215
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1110-aws - 4.4.0-1110.121
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-39-lowlatency - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1076.83
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-185.215').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1110.121').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1076.83').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1042.47').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
